title: The Art of Founder Mode
description: Brian Chesky shares how he transformed Airbnb by getting deeply involved in product decisions and why founders should stay close to the details.
featuredQuote: The best products are built by people who are obsessed with the details. You can't delegate taste.

guest.name: Brian Chesky
guest.title: Co-founder & CEO
guest.bio: Brian Chesky co-founded Airbnb and has led it from a simple idea of air mattresses in a living room to a global hospitality company. He's known for his design-driven approach to building products and his focus on creating experiences people love.

title: Scaling People and Organizations
description: Claire Hughes Johnson discusses her frameworks for building high-performing teams and the operating systems that make great companies work.
featuredQuote: The job of a leader is to create clarity. When people understand the mission and how their work connects to it, magic happens.

guest.name: Claire Hughes Johnson
guest.title: Corporate Officer & Advisor
guest.bio: Claire Hughes Johnson spent over a decade at Google before joining Stripe as COO. She's the author of 'Scaling People' and is known for her expertise in building and scaling high-performing organizations.

title: How to Ship Fast and Win
description: Keith Rabois shares his frameworks for building companies that move fast, make decisions quickly, and outpace the competition.
featuredQuote: Speed is a competitive advantage. The company that ships faster learns faster, and the company that learns faster wins.

guest.name: Keith Rabois
guest.title: General Partner
guest.bio: Keith Rabois is a legendary Silicon Valley operator and investor. He was an early executive at PayPal, LinkedIn, and Square, and is known for his frameworks on building companies that ship fast.

title: Building Airbnb from Air Mattresses to 80B
description: Brian Chesky shares the origin story of Airbnb.
featuredQuote: The best way to predict the future is to design it.
